request.description:
This endpoint allows the user to log out by sending an HTTP POST request to the specified URL.

### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following properties:

- `statusCode` (number): The status code of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    

Example response:

``` json
{
    "statusCode": 0,
    "message": ""
}

 ```

response.name: logout

request.description:
### Login API

This API endpoint allows users to authenticate and obtain a token for accessing protected resources.

#### Request Body

- `userName` (string, required): The username of the user.
    
- `password` (string, required): The password of the user.
    

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following properties:

- `statusCode` (number, required): The status code of the response.
    
- `errorMessage` (string, optional): The error message, if any.
    
- `message` (string, optional): Additional message related to the response.
    
- `responseBody` (object, optional): The response body object.
    
    - `token` (string, required): The authentication token.
        
    - `status` (string, required): The status of the authentication.
        
    - `existing` (boolean, required): Indicates if the user already exists.
        

#### Example Response

``` json
{
  "statusCode": 0,
  "errorMessage": "",
  "message": "",
  "responseBody": {
    "token": "",
    "status": "",
    "existing": true
  }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Add Product

This endpoint allows you to add a new product.

**Request Body**

- `name`: (text) The name of the product.
- `price`: (text) The price of the product.
- `category`: (text) The category of the product.
- `image`: (file) The image of the product.
    

**Response**

- `status`: (text) The status of the request, whether it was successful or not.
- `message`: (text) A message indicating the result of the request.

request.description:
### Delete Product

This endpoint is used to delete a product.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
- URL: `{{local-product-ms}}/v1/product/delete`
- Headers: None
- Body:
    - `code` (string, required): The product code to be deleted.
    - `deleteProduct` (boolean, required): Set to true to confirm the deletion.

#### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema. The schema includes the properties and data types of the response object.

The `PUT /v1/product/update` endpoint is used to update product details. The request should be sent with a form-data body containing the `ProductDetails` parameter of type text, and the `files` parameter of type file.

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the structure of the response data.

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema, which will define the structure of the data returned by the API endpoint.

request.description:
This endpoint handles an HTTP DELETE request to remove a suggestion from the system. The request payload is expected to be in raw format with an LIst

### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema.

response.name: deleteSuggestion

request.description:
### Create Suggestion

This endpoint allows the creation of a new suggestion.

#### Request Body

- `comment` (string): The comment for the suggestion.
    

#### Response

The response of this request is documented as a JSON schema.

response.name: createSuggestion

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to add a new address to the user's profile. The HTTP POST request should be sent to [http://localhost:8801/v1/profile/address/add](http://localhost:8801/v1/profile/address/add) with the following request body parameters:

- addressLine1 (string, required): The first line of the address.
- addressLine2 (string,): The second line of the address.
    
- landmark (string,): A landmark near the address.
    
- city (string, required): The city of the address.
- state (string, required): The state of the address.
- pincode (string, required): The pincode of the address.
- addressName (string, required): A name to identify the address.
- primaryAddress (boolean): Indicates if the address is the primary address.
    

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "statusCode": 0,
    "message": "",
    "responseBody": {
        "landmark": "",
        "addressLine1": "",
        "city": "",
        "state": "",
        "pincode": "",
        "addressName": "",
        "primaryAddress": true
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Delete Driver

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete a driver.

#### Request Body

- The request body should contains list of driverIds
    

#### Response

The response will indicate the success or failure of the delete operation.

### Retrieve Available Drivers

This endpoint retrieves a list of drivers based on criteria.

#### Request

- Method: GET
- Endpoint: `http://localhost:8802/v1/driver/list`
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "statusCode": number,
  "responseBody": {
    "perPage": number,
    "pageNo": number,
    "sortBy": string,
    "sortDirection": string,
    "content": [
      {
        "id": string,
        "name": string,
        "contactNo": string,
        "vehicleNo": string,
        "available": boolean
      }
    ]
  }
}

 ```

### Add Category

This endpoint allows the user to add a new category along with its sub-categories and sub-category items.

**Request Body**

- `name` (text): The name of the category.
    
- `type` (text): The type of the category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[0].name` (text): The name of the first sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[0].type` (text): The type of the first sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[0].subCategory2DtoList[0].name` (text): The name of the first item in the first sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[0].subCategory2DtoList[0].type` (text): The type of the first item in the first sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[0].subCategory2DtoList[1].name` (text): The name of the second item in the first sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[0].subCategory2DtoList[1].type` (text): The type of the second item in the first sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[1].name` (text): The name of the second sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[1].type` (text): The type of the second sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[1].subCategory2DtoList[0].name` (text): The name of the first item in the second sub-category.
    
- `subCategoryDtoList[1].subCategory2DtoList[0].type` (text): The type of the first item in the second sub-category.
    

**Response**

``` json
{
    "statusCode": 0,

        "subCategoryDtoList": [
 ```
